Jeffrey: I'll be damned if i let some cyber punk dig up dirt on me that I've

depends on stopping this freak.
Dinah: Maybe not.
Jeffrey: What are you, nuts?

Dinah: Well, some people seem to think so. I think the key to catching this 
guy isn't by stopping him. I think maybe we should encourage him.
Jeffrey: Give him some more tips about mallet and marina?
Dinah: Maybe some tips that will lead him to a trap.
Jeffrey: A trap, huh?

Dinah: Yeah. Mallet really does everything by the book. And I don't think 
that's the way to draw him out or bring him any closer.
Jeffrey: When you say "him," are you referring to the blogger or mallet?

Marina: I hate it when the lineup is a bust. You spend all that time 
preparing and gathering all the information. It's all for nothing. I mean, it's 
like a party or a wedding that you spent all this time planning and then at the 
last minute, it... I'm going to go file these papers.
Mallet: Hey, hey, hey. Don't let her get to you, okay?
Marina: Who?

Marina: Dinah. You just talk nonstop about the case and tried to avoid my 
eyes, okay? So just relax, forget about what she said. She has a way of taking 
some thing perfectly innocent like you and I working together and turning it 
into...
Marina: Love in the lockup?

Mallet: Yeah. She's just really good at pushing people's buttons, you know? 
She's not malicious. She's just... she can't help herself, I don't know.

Marina: I know. I'm actually really worried about her. I don't know, I think 
she could have gotten herself into some trouble by connecting with this blogger. 
What are you looking at?

Mallet: I'm looking at a cop. Oh, yeah. I'm glad you're on my side. I'll see 
you.
Alan michael: We both know what I can offer you, but what can you offer me?

Beth: Come on now. I'm your father's wife. Don't even pretend that that 
doesn't get your motor running.
Alan michael: So much for learning from experience.

Beth: I've spent enough time as a spaulding to know what is important: To 
keep your options open.
Gus: Nobody's in the hallway.
Harley: What about the phone?
Gus: Oh. Unplugged.
Harley: Beepers, pagers?
Gus: Yeah. Everything's off.

Harley: Honey, is there even a small chance that a carrier pigeon could land

Gus: I didn't think of that. I'll build a scarecrow. I'll build a scarecrow

Harley: Good, good, I like that. No, forget about that. Forget about that. 
Just come here.

Harley: Get to work.
Gus: It's not work. It's a pleasure.
Harley: Honey, are we terrible people for abandoning my father?

Gus: What, are you kidding? I think he could handle ava and olivia, just... 
and if he can't he should just call the police, 911.
Harley: Wait a minute. Aren't we the police?
Gus: Not tonight we're not.

Olivia: See, I blamed you for what happened to emma. I have blamed you for so

Coop: Dad, you know this is purely self-serving, right? She's just doing this

Olivia: Please, please, i know I have no right to ask. But just, if you... 
let me make this right, all right? It will be different this time. I promise you 
I won't disappoint you. Just tell me what I need to do. Give me another chance.

Ava: You want me to forgive and forget, huh? What, so you can take another

Olivia: It won't happen. Why would you believe that? I promise...
Ava: Because I know you.
Olivia: You don't know anything.

Olivia: No, nothing's going to happen, I promise...

Ava: You are lying to me. You are lying. You're lying in front of buzz,
